Precise BioMatch FLEX-H Toolkit Documentation
BioMatch..::.CaptureImage Method
BioMatch Class  Example  See Also  Send Feedback
Precise BioMatch FLEX-H Toolkit 1.4.0
Captures an image from a specified reader. The function returns using callbacks to the BiometricCallback event.

Namespace:  PreciseBiometrics.BMFH
Assembly:  pb_flex_h_net (in pb_flex_h_net.dll) Version: 1.4.0.0 (1.4.0.0)

Syntax

C#
public BM_ReturnCode CaptureImage(
	BM_Reader reader,
	uint timeout,
	out BM_Image image,
	Object context
)
Visual Basic (Declaration)
Public Function CaptureImage ( _
	reader As BM_Reader, _
	timeout As UInteger, _
	<OutAttribute> ByRef image As BM_Image, _
	context As Object _
) As BM_ReturnCode
Visual C++
public:
BM_ReturnCode CaptureImage(
	BM_Reader^ reader, 
	unsigned int timeout, 
	[OutAttribute] BM_Image^% image, 
	Object^ context
)

Parameters

reader
Type: PreciseBiometrics.BMFH..::.BM_Reader
The reader to capture the image.
timeout
Type: System..::.UInt32
The timeout in milliseconds.
image
Type: PreciseBiometrics.BMFH..::.BM_Image %
The returned image if successful.
context
Type: System..::.Object
The optional callback context object.

Return Value

Ok if successful.

Examples

CopyC#
// Declarations
BioMatch bio;       
BM_Reader[] readers;
UInt32 timeout = 10000; // Set timeout to 10 seconds
BM_Image image;
BM_Image displayImage;
Image windowsImage;
UInt32 displayImageSize;
BM_ReturnCode result;

// Create an instance of the BioMatch class
BioMatch bio = new BioMatch();
// Retrieve a list of available biometric readers
bio.ListBiometricReaders(out readers);
// If there is an available reader, capture an image with it
if ((readers != null) && (readers[0] != null))
{
    result = bio.CaptureImage(readers[0], timeout, out image, null);   
    if (result == BM_ReturnCode.BM_OPERATION_TIMED_OUT)
    {
        // Handle timed out event here
    }
    else if (result == BM_ReturnCode.BM_OPERATION_OK)
    {
        // Handle successful operation event here
        // Use the captured image to generate an image suitable for display
        bio.GetImageForViewing(image, 100, 150, 100, out displayImage, out displayImageSize);
        // Display the converted image as a standard image
        windowsImage = displayImage.ToImage();     
        // Update a GUI PictureBox with the Image
        //PictureBox1.Image = windowsImage;
        //PictureBox1.Refresh;
    }
}

Exceptions

ExceptionCondition
System..::.ApplicationExceptionOn failure to successfully capture an image not caused by a timeout or cancel command.
